39024997.review:
Es gibt leider keinen großen roten Knopf.

Push ist ein Spiel, wo räumliches Vorstellungsvermögen von Nöten ist. Man drückt Knöpfe nach logischen Sequenzen oder Mustern, die nach und nach in das Spiel eingeführt werden. Dabei kann man Teilweise die Blöcke die man vor sich hat bewegen oder drehen. Eine Story hat das Spiel nicht.

Grafisch ist das Spiel simpel, aber ansprechend. Kurz gesagt passend, genau wie der Soundtrack. Dieser ist ebenso gut gelungen und nervt nicht. Die Töne, die das Spiel neben der Musik von sich gibt sind auch in Ordnung. Auch der Umfang ist in Ordnung, zumindest für den Preis des Spiels.

Alles im Allem ist es ja eine eindeutige Sache. Wenn man Lust hat, ein paar Knöpfe zu drücken und dabei ein wenig nachzudenken, dann ist das Spiel vollkommen in Ordnung. Wer Knöpfe drücken doof findet, der sollte die Finger hiervon lassen.

39005248.review:
a good game i really love it

worth the money and fun to play

39001403.review: Much like Zenge, Klocki, and Hook, this game feels incredibly polished and satisfying. The goal is to push all the buttons in each level, but there's rules that dictate what moves are valid, rules that you have to figure out for yourself. The game does a great job of allowing you to figure out the puzzles, and introduces enough mechanics that each level feels fresh and is satisfying to complete. The only negative in my mind is that the last level felt a bit out of place, even once I realized the solution. Like those other games, it is short (~1 hour) but a really great experience.

遊戲難度適中，稍加思考嘗試便能通關。
共計六十多關，遊戲時數約一個小時，適合偷閒時光活絡腦袋。

38426147.review:
This is a really good puzzle game. I played the demo on Kongregate and it left me wanting more. This version definitely delivers on that. And it's so cheap, I bought it mostly with funds from my Steam wallet - you really have nothing to lose by getting this game.

You do need to have a very good perception of spatial relationships though. That is an absolute prerequisite for playing this game.

The puzzles are presented without instruction or any sort of text; however, the game is very good at introducing new concepts in a way that is immediately obvious, then expands on those concepts to provide further challenges. Later levels will present you with a combination of several different previously-learned mechanics, so you really have to pay attention. A bit of experimentation is sometimes required (and can sometimes be frustrating until you get it), and each of the puzzles gives you a decent sense of accomplishment when you finally figure it out.

Overall it's worth the dollar or so you'd spend on this, so get it if you're looking for a new puzzle game to hold your interest for a while.

38398950.review:

自分みたいなバカな頭でも理解出来てサクサクプレイできるのでおすすめ

38380828.review:
So when I first started playing this game, I was really concerned about the overall difficulty. The first several puzzles are very straightforward, and don't really involve too much thought. It takes a bit of tinkering to discover what a mechanic means and how it works, but I can at least say they are introduced in a way that allows you to fully understand each before moving on.

The game does get harder though, not by too much, but still, it becomes interesting. I'd say it's worth a buy just to see what the last level is.

Now for some more level-specific commentary:

[spoiler]
Best types of puzzles were the ones where you had to rotate parts of the level such that the arrow buttons were solvable, and the expanding black/white arrow button puzzle. I really enjoyed how well and robustly you used the block rotation mechanic, moving parts out of the way and moving the center of rotation led to a lot of very interesting side effects.

I really liked how the squares and circles were introduced to teach how you would have to handle one set of buttons at a time, but I didn't really like the levels that had both numbered dots and numbered lines. Counting backwards for the lines didn't really add anything to the game in my opinion.

The moving block levels were nice, and I kind of miss them. I liked the ones where you would manipulate the block and not see it move, and you'd either have to switch back and forth or just keep track of its position in your mind better. I wish you had combined this with the black/white mechanic more and the switches/rotation buttons. That could have led to some really interesting movement puzzles. 

The way I saw it, what was super important about the block is that you would need to figure out how to always solve the outer "layer" of buttons first. Adding the black/white mechanic with moving parts would have made this a much more interesting process.

I also wish you had played more with weird block topology, with curved edges. I think that showed up once in one of the lategame double-arrow puzzles, but it would have been neat to have that expanded upon.

I noticed some inconsistencies with block rotation, when it seems a button should have been rotated, but wasn't (big black/white pyramid arrow puzzle). That level was the only case that I found.

[/spoiler]

Overall, a short, cute, puzzle game. The mechanics are a bit simplistic, and are developed very slowly, but they are still developed well. The last few levels of the game were fun in a way I don't think I've seen in any other puzzle game. 

If you're looking for a chill not-too-difficult puzzle game, this is perfect for you. If you're like me and were looking for something a bit harder, this is still worth checking out. Think about what the mechanics really do, and how they work together. It could have been made to be a bit harder, but was still very carefully developed.

37959522.review: More brilliant puzzles from Maciej Targoni and Michal Pawlowski. While I did encounter audio issues, PUSH still pushes all the right buttons - highly accessible, un-punishing, interesting mechanics, with a proper difficulty curve. Thank you, devs!

37943716.review:
Push is no where near as well crafted as Klocki, but on its own it's still a solid puzzle game, albiet more stressful than anticipated for a "relaxing puzzle game." Much like Klocki the game does a superb job explaining how to play through its gameplay rather than explanations. Unlike Klocki, however, some of the puzzle "rules" can get more convoluted than The Witness, and that's saying something.

Whether you're a casual puzzle solver or a more experienced one, Push is a game that will keep you occupied for a good couple hours.

37941408.review:
Push starts out very simple (literally pushing buttons) but later puzzles produce curious ways of looking around and manipulating an object in 2D and 3D.

Of the games in the ‘Relaxing Puzzle Box Bundle’ created by Maciej Targoni and Michal Pawlowski, Push just has been my least favorite so far but it’s still a good value and very interesting.

Something dissimilar from the other puzzle box games is that Push lacks a final ‘gauntlet’. Elements do add on top of each other to created more intricate puzzles. However, about 3 times throughout the game these elements get dropped and a new sequence of different types of puzzles show up in their place. Also, this was the only puzzle box game so far that had me solve a few puzzles, the ones designed to introduce me to a new idea, that I was still confused about even after solving them. A lot of puzzles in Push also feel rather enviable, as in as long as you were patient and observant you’d find everything. Sort of like untangling string or something.

Also no steam trading cards this time around. This is just stranger than it is important however. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

While it’s a comparatively shakier game than Hook and klocki were, it’s still a unique, inexpensive puzzle game that I would recommend for a movie’s-length relaxing challenge.

37935663.review:
A short ~60 ish levels puzzle game. Appears like a minimalist low-poly set up but has some moderately tricky 3D spatial awareness moments.
I have somewhat mixed feelings about this game. Overall the puzzles are not extremely difficult, once you learn how to play. And learning is mostly by trial and error, while following in-game cues like an arrow. It's an interesting way of learning, not being given instructions. I don't know if I'm a fan of it as there were moments where I ended up learning an incorrect "rule" for a particular button.
The most difficult puzzles require you to be able to dissassemble the environment and predict its topology when rearranged, and I did think the more difficult of the puzzles were very good.
There is some background music in this, but it occasionaly become distorted and crackly, which is not very pleasant.
Overall, I would recommend this game, if only for the more difficult 3D thinking puzzles.

37931239.review:
一款很休闲的游戏，同这个开发商出的其他游戏一样。
一开始还很简单，到了后面······“这解不开啊！” “哎？这里还有一个按钮？？？”······基本这样的，还是很简单的（滑稽）
难度有些像纪念碑谷，就是你瞎走，竟然还能通······
[spoiler] 然而我不会告诉你们最后一关是可以解开的2333 只要仔细看成就的名字就会知道该怎么摁 [/spoiler]
箭头的基本规则：沿着箭头指向的方向前进，可以绕形状一圈然后按下后面的按钮
至于双箭头，没有摸索出规律的可以告你们是怎么回事
沿着双箭头A的方向前进，到达第一个符合要求的按钮B时（注意黑白底色按钮），遵循这个按钮的方向再前进到按钮C处（按钮C满足的条件为：与按钮B颜色相同）。
比如>  |>>   <，按下顺序就是213，更复杂的 |>> >  << > < 按下顺序就是15234 [spoiler] 不得不承认这种玩双箭头的方法很反智233 [/spoiler]

37930216.review:
PUSH has you doing exactly what the title suggests -- pushing buttons.  It starts off very simply, easing you into the more complex puzzles that follow.  No overt instructions are given.  Whenever a new twist is added, you're provided with an easy puzzle so that you can figure out how things work before you're tossed into the deep end.  It's a game that's simple to explain (you push buttons!) but challenging enough to get your neurons firing.

Also, when you solve a level, all the buttons go clickety-clack before the puzzle flies off the screen.  Very satisfying.

37849341.review: A short puzzle game about pushing buttons in a specific order as indicated by their decals. You need to do some spatial reasoning in order to solve the puzzles. I managed to beat it pretty fast, but then again it is pretty cheap.

37786380.review: a good little puzzle game that is all about logical connections the only problem I had was there was maybe 2-3 times the logic the game used was wrong (that or the way i solved the puzzle was wrong however the way i solved the puzzles stayed the same and it worked on the other puzzles perfectly)

37752249.review:
This is a delightful puzzle game, especially if you are using a touch screen interface to play it. It's like I'm actually pressing the buttons! :3c 

The music is calm, and the puzzles are fun to solve. I have played many other games by these creators, and what I like especially about this one is that, compared to the others, I've had to use my memory skills as much as my problem-solving ones (short-term memory is something I'm rather bad at, so it's nice to get to work on it). I also like that I get to figure out how the mechanics work by playing with the pieces in a trial-and-error manner.

37730337.review:
Short but great. 
The idea is simple; push the buttons in the right order, but it keeps layering up mechanics that make this increasingly complicated to pull off. It never gets too difficult though and it can make you smile when you work out the trick and start speeding through button pushes.

A lot of games stick minamilist on as short hand for 'Im a bit crap at art' but thats not the case here, it looks and sounds fantastic, and can leave out instructions and details because its designed well enough that you rarely feel tricked by a poorly communicated mechanic. 

There was one issue I ran in to where after twenty minutes or so the sound started to click somewhat as if a buffer had run out, but its quick to restart and get back in to it so wasnt too much of an issue. 

Otherwise, its a very polished little puzzle game, and like the others in the puzzle box bundle very satisfying to play and complete.

37631373.review: very entertaining puzzle game, beat the game in two hours, definitely worth a dollar

37585625.review: Clever button pusher that challenges you to think three dimensionally to solve the puzzles. Clean and easy to understand without instruction. Definitely worth the price like the other games from the development team.

Cute small puzzle. It's pretty easy until about level 50, which is about when I had to start thinking about how pieces moved. And there were a few spots where it took me several tries to form the right theory about sequencing.

And then it's over too soon. I feel like it could have gotten much harder and stayed interesting. It gets maybe about as hard as the 3rd or 4th level of Snakebird. But it's fun and pleasant enough while it lasts.

36952998.review:
4th game of Maciej, as always minimalistic puzzle game.
This game shares a lot of pros and cons with previous games like hook, cloki, zenge. If you loved these games, then you will definitely like this one.

Pros
 - Minimal style. No score, no leaderboards and clean interface.
 - Ambient atmosphere. Makes you feel consentrated.
 - Intuitive sense. Let you know how puzzle works, without teaching or instuction.

Cons
 - Some rules are very hard to figure out how that works.
 - Game is short. I finished the game in 1 hour. However, it was good experience in 1$!

36793196.review: Bardzo przyjemna gra, żeby zrelaksować się wieczorami

36564916.review:
God, this game is RIDICULOUSLY well-designed. 

It's an abstract, minimalistic puzzle game like no other; it's probably closest to klocki (another clever minimalist puzzle game I'd recommend with unique mechanics by the same developer), but even then it's still very different from its predecessor.

To play PUSH, you must press buttons on 3-dimensional objects, and in a specific sequence or pattern. And at the same time, like with klocki, you must also figure out the mechanics or rules of the button patterns, or the entire pattern resets. This leads to a sort of investigative trial-and-error gameplay that just feels genius when all put together (how do people even design puzzles like this?). Again like klocki, the game starts almost trivially easy and smoothly transitions to more tricky puzzling, especially as the different mechanics combine together.

The whole experience feels like playing through a visual-spacial, mental-rotation, intelligence test. But unlike the IQ tests, the game also feels rewarding and soothing with its abstract visual design, soothing music, and forgiving gameplay that rewards experimentation. It's also very affordable, like $1? If you appreciate simple games with unique gameplay, I would definitely recommend giving this game a try. 

(One note though: I would recommend playing through the game by actually trying to understand the rules of each mechanic and pattern. Just like with other finite puzzle games on PC, it is possible to solve each puzzle by randomly guessing, but that kind of playstyle doesn't really reward you for seeing how each button is connected in sequence.)

36526798.review:
真的是非常喜欢Maciej Targoni和Michal Pawlowski做的解谜小游戏
HOOK、klocki，Zenge、Art Of Grabvity
这次他们合作出了这一款PUSH，以按按钮来解谜的小游戏。

说实话。。前期真的很落智，本以为像WayOut一样，结果发现只要合并同类项(x)即可，123456，654321也很蠢，空间切换，拼图，再到一边控制另一边一个红色方块进行运动代替鼠标点击，然后整合这些小谜题成大谜题。
这都只是繁琐而已，不是解谜。

这个前期太容易劝退了，以为这个游戏就这样了，浪费鼠标点击寿命。

然而，后半部分却实在是惊艳到我了，特别是“全黑Y型”需要点好几下才能开启谜题的那一关，真的惊艳到我了。
抽屉式的推入推出，平面的移动和转动。

前期落智的解谜拖沓来的烦躁感一扫而光，
甚至在THANKS FOR PLAYING出现时还意犹未尽。
[spoiler] 结果最后一个谜题毫无头绪x[/spoiler] 

感觉这些个花样还能出很多很多的谜题！！！！

期待下一作！！

36511590.review:
I don't know some complain about "trial-and-error" problems - it's logical, and when something doesn't work, there's a good reason why. (e.g. double arrows + black&white = black&white come first, then double arrow, which doesn't skip arrows in the same direction, but follows the next two as it's shown WITHOUT pressing the first in the sequence - I'm sure this is one of the things that frustrated people)
I personally loved how the stage placement and layout acted as examples for the player to figure out and establish rules for themselves - if you play careful attention to the first 2~3 stages that a new button is introduced, you'll notice it's designed to teach you something about its rules.
Overall, great game design and value for the money :D

36479933.review:
La drogue, c'est le mal. Pourtant, à y regarder de plus près, la cocaïne semble faire le plus grand bien à ces hamsters-là. Le duo de développeurs à l'origine de [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/367580][i][b]Hook[/b][/i][/url], [i][b][url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/461840]Zenge[/url][/b][/i], [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/499440][i][b]klocki[/b][/i][/url] et enfin [i][b][url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/642560]Art of Gravity[/url][/b][/i], se fend d'un nouveau puzzle-game, dont la simplicité le dispute à l'ingéniosité.

Comme d'habitude, la réalisation est minimaliste, mais n'en demeure pas moins d'une propreté au-dessus de tout reproche. [i]Aller à l'essentiel[/i] doit vraisemblablement être leur mot d'ordre, ce qui revient en l'occurence à privilégier le gameplay. Lequel se résume en un mot, un seul : [i][b]PUSH[/b][/i]. De fait, il s'agit de pousser (ou plutôt d'appuyer) sur diverses dalles, sur lesquelles se trouvent le plus souvent des symboles : des dessins, des numérotations ou encore des sortes de flèches. Pour espérer terminer les 67 niveaux qu'il compte, il vous faudra enfoncer toutes ces dalles dans un ordre particulier, qu'on vous laisse d'ailleurs le soin de découvrir.

Et c'est précisément là où les choses se corsent, pour deux raisons. La première, vous vous en apercevrez vite, rebutera bon nombre de joueurs : rien (j'ai bien dit [u]rien[/u]) ne vous est expliqué quant au fonctionnement des mécanismes qui entrent en jeu. La seconde découle du nombre de ces mécanismes, au point qu'il me serait par trop laborieux d'en faire un exposé à la fois exhaustif et intelligible. A défaut, je me contenterai de vous dire que l'ordre dans lequel il faut appuyer sur ces dalles peut être fonction de plusieurs paramètres : la croissance ou la décroissance de leur numérotation, l'alternance de couleurs (noir et blanc), la correspondance des formes, leur orientation,... et j'en oublie sûrement.

Il vous sera en outre possible de faire glisser ou pivoter certaines parties du décor, ce qui présente l'avantage de révéler des dalles auparavant cachées. Dit comme ça, j'ai bien conscience que le fonctionnement de toutes ces mécaniques puisse vous paraître quelque peu obscur. Pourtant, tout est très simple, en vérité. Et d'une difficulté très abordable, puisqu'il se boucle en une paire d'heures environ. Toujours est-il qu'il propose un gameplay ingénieux, d'autant plus qu'il est compréhensible sans qu'on nous donne la moindre explication. Le tout pour un prix défiant toute concurrence.

[h1]Verdict : 4,5/5 - Excellent, à acheter les yeux fermés ![/h1]

[code]Vous avez aimé cette évaluation ? Retrouvez-en d'autres en rejoignant notre groupe de rédaction : [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/onlespreferefroids#curation]On les préfère froids.[/url][/code]

36431745.review:
--This deserves the title of a puzzling game!--
________________________________________

I don't own a fidget cube, but when I first saw one, I wondered if it had  any additional "challenge" to it, or was just a "freelance-/sandbox/skirmish thing" - so in this game you need to figure out the sequence and the rules there are to it.
__________________________________
(and if you feel a lack of story or tutorial, just imagine some never seen before entity gave you an object and you are supposed to solve the sequence or you, existence and "your planet/loved ones" are not worthy and GAME OVER - scenario might occur... or.. you will just not come back to whatever state you were unless you are done with it - so why be bothered by a few moments of trial and error if you might require them...) 

___________________________________

Some might say it's too expensive for being so short-lived, but it was worth the while!

To be honest I didn't want to leave it at some state until I really might get stuck, regarless of the fact it's almost 3 a.m. right now,

so it's not even too short - or is it :>

Even if e.g. that "send the cube around" thing was unnecessarily complicated, or "gay" youth might say

It first felt like a reminder of those logic tests, which have a "different logic" than you -yourself- might interpret (out of the whole thing and its boundaries of "regulations").

That's also due to the fact  no one explains you the criteria, actually they do make  (some kind of) sense, though!

One might even dare say they don't have alternatives that might leave some open room for misinterpretation, really. So there's few reason left to criticise the tasks/puzzles themselves for any reason(s).
________________________
Ow!

The game is named Push

seems I got carried away too much (just like the review does/did?)

Took me a while to figure what in the world to push to complete the very last puzzle

Good thing the right letter stays lit in light blue for as long as it's still correct!!!
____________

The soundtrack is nicely calming, more "spheric" than ambient, so the time passing while playing does not really get underlined but interweaves with it. And it's still remarkable enough to -not- have the feel of "huh? there was music playing?" or "I don't remember/recognise it / it was there, but "I'm not feeling it"   such as a running radio might give,  and you don't even want to realise there's actual(ly) music playing, just a heap of sounds and tones, nothing special to catch your attention, no matter how catchy they tried to make it... or you (get) haunt(ed by) whatever it's been throwing at you 1000 times until you can expel it (that way?.. or by parodising/plagiarising to lessen any of its remarkableness) again

Should you make a DLC that really carries the game on, or a sequel; I'll sure grab it (too).

36406198.review: Vey nice game, simple, creative and tough as well. It is a nice and welcome change from all the war games we're used to and it is definetely a favorite.

36381731.review:
I'm into puzzle games and this one, while a bit challenging in the last levels, was definetly less frustrating than klocki imo. Maybe shorter too, but for its price it's an enjoyable piece of work with great visual and atmosphere. That's hypnotizing.

The only downside i'd point is that some levels didn't felt logic and were solved by mere luck while the previous and next ones made perfect sense. I really don't know what to say about that. Still it didn't spoil my fun.

In the end it's a very good (and short eheh) experience I recommend to graphic puzzle lovers. 
PS : you better be 3D sensitive, if you are into flat stuff, I'd be cautious about this product.

36149166.review:
PUSH to kolejna gra twórcy świetnych łamigłówek - Michała Pawłowskiego.
Niestety, w przeciwieństwie do klocków, Zenge czy Hook ta podobała mi się najmniej. A szkoda. To naprawdę dobra łamigłówka.

Największa wada PUSH leży w... przyciskach. Tak, początkowe poziomy są proste i można je przejść bez żadnego tutoriala, ale późniejsze, kiedy mamy 2 serie klokców, które musimy wcisnąć w odpowiedniej kolejności jednak wymagają objaśnienia jak dokładnie owe przyciski działają.

Przykład 1. W planszach 8  wprowdzono nowe typy przycisków. Dotychczas wciskaliśmy przyciski od najmniejszego numeru do największego. Te działają odwrotnie. Niestety nie jest to w żaden sposób objaśnione.

Przykład 2. W poziomie 45 byłem bliski poddania się, ponieważ nie wiedziałem jak działają te strzałki. Było okropnie trudno odgadnąć tą prawidłową kombinację przycisków. Do teraz nie wiem, czemu ta plansza ma takie a nie inne rozwiązanie.

Niestety PUSH to jedyna gra z zakupionej przeze mnie paczki, której nie przeszedłem. A wystarczyło do gry dodać zaledwie kilka linijek tekstu...

36132409.review:
퍼즐을 풀려면 모든 버튼을 눌러야 다음 스테이지로 넘어가게 되는데 각 버튼에 그려진 문양에 따라 눌러야 하는 순서 또는 규칙이 정해져있다. 스테이지가 넘어감에 따라서 버튼에 그려진 문양의 종류가 늘어나게 되는데  후반에 가면 늘어난 버튼의 종류 때문에 어느정도 머리를 써야 한다. 이 게임은 처음에 어떻게 플레이 하는지 알려주지도 않아서 처음에는 당황했다. 그리고 새로운 문양이 나올 때도 별다른 설명이 없기 때문에 이리저리 눌러보아서 알아내거나 문양을 살펴보면 직감적으로 느낌이 온다.
퍼즐의 난이도는 어렵지 않아서 간단하게 하기는 좋다. 나도 여유롭게 플레이 했는데 1.1시간 밖에 걸리지 않았기 대문에 퍼즐의 양도 그렇게 많지는 않다.  1100원 값어치는 한다고 생각한다. 그래도 양이 작으니 Relaxing Puzzle Box 번들로 퍼즐 5개를 묶어서 파니 번들로 사면 더 싸게 즐길 수 있다.

*도전과제는 그냥 클리어하면 끝난다.

36086595.review:
I really enjoyed the previous games by the same developers (hook, zenge, klocki, art of gravity) and was looking forward to this one as well, but it involves way too much trial & error due to unclear (for me at least) mechanics to be enjoyable, especially in the last quarter or so of the game, definitely not the 'relaxing experience' mentioned on the store page. luckily, making a mistake doesn't reset the entire level if it has more than one pattern to complete, otherwise I would've shelved it before completing it for sure.

it also has the usual 'minimalistic puzzle' issues, like no volume sliders, level numbers, level select screen (left and right arrows only, for 67 levels, takes a while to go back and forth if you want to), and progress being stored in the registry. the config screen for resolution options and windowed mode was enabled in a patch, so there's that, and the music's nice too.

35984338.review:
パズルゲーム。
画面にある全てのボタンを押した状態にするパズルだ。全67ステージ。
ボタンを押すには規則性を自分で探してその順番通りに押す必要がある。このゲームを例えて言うならば、規則性を探す知能テストの問題を立体にしてギミックを付け足したようなものというイメージに近い。ギミックを動作させるスイッチがゴチャゴチャして少し面倒なステージはいくつかあるが、難易度的にはそれほど難しくはない。ボリューム的には2時間程度だが内容がしっかりしているので非常にコストパフォーマンスが高い。パズルが好きならオススメのゲームだ。

35979625.review:
I was looking forward to this game and can, so far, say that the gameplay is enjoyable.
It's a simple enough premise: press all of the buttons. As you get further into the game, rules come up that prevent you from simply pressing the buttons in whichever order you please, slightly increasing the difficulty. That much is fun.
However, there's one glaring issue that I wish I could overlook and that's the audio. The audio, a few levels in, begins to double over (two clicks being played on top of another instead of the one click) and pop with staticky crackles that don't fit with the feel of the rest of the game. About 5 or 10 levels after I first noticed the sound issues, they got so bad (sometimes tripling up, or even more) that I couldn't ignore it any more and had to close the game because the noise was so unpleasant. This was really unfortunate because I was really looking forward to this game and play these games to relax! The audio issues were just so bad that I was getting more stressed out; and I usually so look forward to the really sharp audio editing in these games. :(
I would gladly change my opinion of this if only the audio problem was fixed.

35885204.review: Игра выполнена в минималистичном стиле и с приятной музыкой, ничто не отвлекает и не мешает решать головоломку. Для того, чтоб пройти уровень, нужно нажимать кнопки в определенной последовательности. По мере прохождения будут добавляться новые кнопки с другими значениями, и последовательность нажатия кнопок тоже меняется. Первые 15-20 уровней проходятся очень просто, а дальше добавляются различные элементы и приходится хорошенько подумать.

Очередная головоломка от создателей «Hook» и «Zenge». В игре неспешный, расслабляющий геймплей.
Перед нами объемные фигуры с кнопками. Надо сделать так, чтобы все кнопки были нажаты, но нажимаются они в определенном порядке. Надо догадаться в каком порядке нажимать. Если ошибаетесь, то кнопки отскакивают. Тогда цепочку нажатий начинаем снова.
Необычная головоломка, в которой нет обучения, таймера, очков или ходов. Все, что от вас требуется, - нажать на все кнопки!

35872324.review:
[h1]«PUSH»[/h1]
Логическая головоломка. Нужно догадаться в какой последовательности нажимать кнопки.
Цель каждого уровня – нажать все кнопки. Нажимать нужно в логической последовательности. В какой? Вот об этом вы и должны догадаться!
Геймплей:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pdh32cgBdXU

Первые уровни легкие. Просто нажимаем одинаковые фигуры. Затем добавляются математические последовательности, затем рисунки. С каждым уровнем меняется сложность, задача и внешний вид самой головоломки.

Необычная и увлекательная игра, развивающая логику. Рекомендую в коллекцию!

It's worth more than that for the gameplay alone. 10/10.

35843918.review: From the creators of Klocki and Hook comes another fantastic puzzler.  The concept is extremely simple: Press all the blue buttons to finish the level.  That sounds incredibly simple, but the game introduces different types of buttons which must be pressed in a specific order according to a rule set.  The game does an absolutely fantastic job of teaching you the different rules and gradually building up to ridiculously complex puzzles.  They start with the simplest possible puzzle involving that symbol, and then give you another simple puzzle that requires a deeper understanding of the rule, and so on.  If I have one complaint about the game, it is that they introduce a lot of mechanics that are swiftly dropped and never used again, which is kind of disappointing.  Unlike Klocki, there's no great final puzzle where everything comes together unfortunately.  That being said, the puzzle do get increasingly difficult as the game goes on, and the final puzzles were such brain melters that I think that if you showed the solutions to someone, it would be completely impossible to reverse engineer an understanding of the mechanics.  Overall another very high quality entry in this series of claming puzzlers from Hamsters on Coke games.

35840732.review:
买的HOOK提醒我又出了一款风格类似的游戏
想都不想直接买了（心情简单）
一如既往地简约清新，背景音乐给人一种很空灵的感觉
适合饭后排忧解闷，怼tmd
刚入手玩时觉得特别简单简直侮辱智商，但是转念又一想不行千万不能被这种假象欺骗（HOOK心得）
果然到了后期难度爆炸
——好吧也不是特别爆炸，只是需要稍作停顿发挥空间想象能力然后开始疯狂规划
游戏时间大约一到一个半个小时，挑个闲暇的时间一次性通关吧
画面非常唯美，进场出场都很流畅舒服
ps最后一关是需要在字母里找出PUSH，这样就能获得成就了（我会说我一开始不知道在想啥居然拼命在拼happy birthday?）

35838921.review:
PUSH is a very nice minimalistic puzzle game that will provide you with something between one and two hours of playtime. Each of the 60+ levels is about pushing buttons situated on an 3D shape in a particular order. There are no explanations as to what that order could be but each button is marked with a symbol that hints to the solution order.

So you first need to figure out the meaning of the button symbols through trial and error / through logical deduction. Further mechanics include among others panning and rotating particular parts of the 3D shape you are working with, and multilple dimensions with different 3D shapes to work with in a single level.

I'd say that the learning curve is pretty flat in the first 20 levels but after that, puzzles become increasingly complex while still introducing new puzzle mechanics. I had great fun solving the remaining two thirds of the puzzles and they do provide for a satisfactory mental challenge.

Finally, given all the above I do not hesitate to recommend this game to any fan of puzzle games. Go and get it since it is only 1€ (or even lkess if you get it in the bundle).

35835912.review:
Another fantastic short puzzle game from the creator of Klocki, Zenge and Hook. In this one your job is to push all the buttons in each puzzle in a specific sequence on the 3D surface.

In each puzzle you could be matching numbers, shapes, following numerical sequences, following directions and more. In later levels parts of the puzzle can be rotated and moved as the puzzle appears on all surfaces. New concepts are usually introduced well in short puzzles before expanding the concept to more complex ones and there was only one early on that involved counting up and then down that was a little unclear.

At about an hour or so the game won't outstay it's welcome and is a steal at the low price.

35835550.review: Excellent relaxing puzzle game from creators of Klocki and Art of Gravity. Neat and smooth graphic design with ambient sounds. Buttons with various shapes, colours, symbols and even base colour must be pushed in right order to clear the level. No instructions or tips provided.

35823330.review:
PUSH is a testimony that you do not need complex game mechanics, an absurd amount of content or even a line of text to have a great time.

With the simple premise of pushing buttons on a sequence (discovering said sequence is the puzzle), it makes you feel immersed from the first puzzle forward. 

There isn't really that much that you can talk about mechanic wise without spoiling the discovery process (arguably of the best parts of the game). However, it is safe to say that every puzzle kept things fresh until the very end. And the fact that previously introduced mechanics meet once again in the later puzzles, adds a layer of depth that is missing from several other puzzle games.

I can't really find something bad to say gameplay-wise about the game, other than the fact that some levels were a bit tedious (to name an example, some with the multi-screen portals), but there are only a couple of levels like that, and said mechanics don't ever come back. So the positives definately obliterate the few pet peeves I had.

Yes, the game is short, around the hour worth of length. Yes, it is one of those games that you will likely play only once. But it sticks with you for much longer, it is criminally cheap, the time you play it is very enjoyable, and all in all it'll leave you waiting for the developers to launch their next experience.

PUSH is just that good.

There are fun moments, particularly near the end, but there's far too much tedium to get to those fun moments.

If it were a physical puzzle, one would at least have the pleasure of interacting with a tangible object while learning to manipulate it, but in software, for whatever reason in this case, it doesn't quite work.
  
2.5/5
